docs.abstract: Tony Gervino essay notes that it has become standard practice for fans to storm the court following college basketball victories, and that NCAA is unlikely to stem behavior because it plays so well on television.

docs.snippet: Basketball players from the Robert M. Beren Academy in Houston won the right to compete in a state tournament without having to play on the Jewish Sabbath. Then they had to win their games on the court....
docs.lead_paragraph: Basketball players from the Robert M. Beren Academy in Houston won the right to compete in a state tournament without having to play on the Jewish Sabbath. Then they had to win their games on the court.
docs.abstract: Geneva School of Boerne boys basketball team defeats Robert M Beren Academy, Orthodox Jewish day school in Houston, Tex, 68-67, in quadruple overtime, to win state semifinal game; Beren players drew worldwide attention in 2012 after refusing to play on the Jewish Sabbath.

headline.seo: Jewish Academy Competes in Texas, After Winning the Right to Play
headline.main: Right to Play Is a Victory for a Texas School

headline.seo: Men’s Basketball Coach Steve Forbes Has Led a Turnaround at Northwest Florida State
headline.main: A Recruiter at Heart Is Able to Build a Winner at Any Level
